ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: History of thought concerning the Gothic and the Middle Ages, focusing late 18th century and onwards. Even apart from the visual interest inherent in Medieval revivals, the intellectual arguments and historiography are very compelling. Would recommend.

While conceived as a geographical survey of medieval revivalisms, the course took on other aspects, becoming an extended discussion of the origins of art history as a disciple. I would encourage all students interested in exploring the role of the Gothic in 19th-century intellectual history to enroll.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The course engaged disciplinary theme, explicitly during the first month, then implicitly throughout, making it of interest to all art historians, regardless of specialization.
